name: TheAtlantic
text: The United States spends more on health care than any other developed country. What would it take to reduce the country‚Äôs health-care costs without sacrificing the quality of care? Join us now for day two of #TheAtlanticFest 2020. https://t.co/AP5KOo8MZz

name: TheAtlantic
text: Instead of individual episodes that impinge upon us, like bombs lobbed by an angry god, disasters are now an ongoing and possibly permanent texture to our lives, writes @Emma_Marris. And we cannot forget‚Äîthese are disasters. https://t.co/UtvXftduYL

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @ibogost: People tend to think that friendships are most real when carried out in person. But the pandemic forced us to put our friends at a distance. @evahagberg asks: What if this new architecture of friendship is a good thing, actually?

https://t.co/da1yyAwv2H

name: TheAtlantic
text: Many Democrats are nervous about the debates. But if elections were won by following debate-club rules, Hillary Clinton would be the president and Elizabeth Warren would be the 2020 Democratic nominee, @IsaacDovere reports: https://t.co/OIfHJ04n2S

name: TheAtlantic
text: The pandemic has made it harder to see friends in person. But it has also released us from the expectation that closeness requires physical proximity. That could allow new ways for friendships to flourish, writes @evahagberg. https://t.co/gY5qQXdlUj
